label: 連歌
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 3:  Medieval Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1990
説明文: A type of linked verse unique to Japan, with a set number of stanzas that two or more poets generally composed in alternation. The alternated stanzas comprise the traditional two parts of waka: a unit of three lines of five, seven, and five syllables; and a couplet of seven syllables each. Usually consists of one hundred stanzas or a multiple thereof.　[和歌]
